reviews:
the aroma: caramel and fruity, hints of brown bread, nuts, raisin, cookies, honey...
the taste: caramel and fruity, notes of brown…

Okay for me . Expected more and think it’s because I prefer a nice round hazelnut stout kind of taste and the brown ale was bit thin and more towards almonds. Nice looker but rather thin and fizzy too. Would take again though and would  love to try if it’s on cask
Light brown and cloudy with an off-white head and a caramel nose. Nicely-carbonated with a medium mouthfeel and a caramel, chocolate Roman candy finish.
Nut brown as advertised, whispy head. Coppery aroma. Rich taste of malt, dried winter fruits, hazelnut, biscuit, sweet finish. Fine brown ale.

Aroma : Malty toffee, tiny hints of chocolate & nut with a light earthy hoppy note.  Taste : Medium body & texture. Moderately hoppy bitterness throughout with a tiny touch of sweetness in background. Overriding flavour is a strong malty toffee, with little hints of chocolate & Brazil nut. Decent Brown Ale

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Clear brown with small beige head. Aroma of sweet malts, nuts, caramel, light aromatic hop. Taste is very malty with sweetness, toffee, nuts, some chocolate. Light to medium bodied and highish carbonation. Quite tasty.
355ml bottle. Pours clear brown with a small beige head. Aroma is chocolate, malt, toffee. Taste is light sweet, toffee, nutty. Light bitter finish.
Brown with a tan head.  Aroma is nutty and malts.  Taste is malty band barley.  Similar to a red ale
Woody, Nutty, full of goodness, deliciousness and for those who loved the old Newcastle, some reminders of those notes are present. Samuel smith fan for years.

Cerveza de color marrón caramelo con una cabeza de color canela y esponjosa no muy densa.
Aroma a malta tostado, caramelo y frutos secos.
Sabor a malta tostada, caramelo, nueces y algunos sabores afrutados. Hay una cuantía media de amargor en el paladar que perdura después de cada sorbo. Esta cerveza tiene un buen nivel de carbonatación con una sacudida en boca fresca.
En general, esta es una buena cerveza con unas esencias y sabores que la hacen bastante fácil de beber.

Bottle Haket 2021-03-02 Göteborg 
AR: roasted malt, semi sweet nutty
AP: deep amber, wee head
F: roasted malt, semi sweet nutty, caramel

500ml bottle delivered by the Blue Boar, Leicester and drunk at home. Light brown, cmear with a quuckly dissipating off-white head. Light malty aroma, some woddy notes, chestnut. Sweet nutty taste turns slightly bitter on the finish. A bit of woody tang in the aftertaste. Slightly watery body with carbonation on the heavy side. A step above your average British bitter, nothing vey terribly special but a nice drink all the same.

En Almería (casa). Botella de 355ml. BestBefore: 02/22. Resvisión realizada según la Guía BJCP 2015 para el estilo British Brown Ale (13B).
-Aroma:  bajo a malta tostada, bizcocho, caramelo, toffee; muy bajo a nuez, casi inapreciable. 5/12
-Apariencia: color marron claro, rubí al trasluz. Claridad brillante. Espuma blanquecina, fina pero persistente. 3/3
-Sabor: bajo dulzor a malta, bajo amargor. Balance maltoso con final ligeramente amargo y seco. 13/20
-SB: cuerpo ligero, carbonatación baja. Sin cremosidad. 3/5
-IG: Una Brown Ale que se ajusta al estilo pero sin destacar en ningún atributo. Se echa de menos algo más de cuerpo que podría conseguirse aumentando la temperatura de macerado. 6/10
TOTAL: 30-MUY BUENA

Pours clear amber with white head.  Moderate retention and good carbonation.  Browned malty aroma.  Strong cherry/concord grape taste.  Even mouthfeel with a dry, bitter finish.  Overall not a lot going on besides the grape thing; makes me wonder if it's out of code, but they didn't date the bottles.

Barwa trudna do określenia. Czerwonawo rubinowo różowa. Słuszna beżowa piana. Drobna, sztywna. Tak na oko kremowej konsystencji. Krążkuje aż miło. Aromat słodowo orzechowy. Odrobinę przypomina koźlaka. 
Bobrze nasycone. Puszyste i kremowe. Delikatna goryczka nie przeszkadza w delektowaniu się słodowością. 
Oprócz orzechowych są i nuty chlebowe. Delikatnie słodkie. Odrobina wodnistości sprawia że piwo jest bardzo pijalne.
Bottle from LCBO gift pack. Pours brown lots of frothy head and lacing. Notes are tea, hazelnut, light plum. Taste light bitter medium sweet. Creamy body light carbonation.
Nutty and raisins aromas. Taste is dry, nutty-malty with nice hoppy finish.

W aromacie orzechy, karmel, lekkie estry. Fajna ciemnobursztynowa opalizująca barwa. W smaku mniej orzechów, więcej nut herbacianych, trochę karmelowych i biszkoptowych. Finisz nawet całkiem wytrawny. Dobre piwo, nieskomplikowane ale charakterystyczne i pijalne.

Some light rust and caramel. A little leather and black tea. Pours dark amber with ok initial head. This is probably a little highly rated - one of those posterity things. A touch of bark in the finish, and some woody cloying tang. Bottle.
Una cerveza de color castaño rojizo, con notas a pasas, higos, bollería y en general dulces. Cuerpo medio y con acidez persistente en boca.
White long lasting head, nut brown colour. Nice malty aroma with some chocolate notes. Good one!

Rocky off white head left a froth on a reddish brown still body.
Malt & sweet spiced aroma.
Medium bodied, average carbonation & clean on the back.
Nutty, roasted, malt, syrup & liquorice tastes.
It's a good one.

550ml bottle brewed in England at 5%. A clear ruby with shades of dark amber; not really nut-brown (when held up to the light at least, would pass as nut-brown in a dimly lit pub for sure), with a sizeable good-duration head. Aromas of chocolate and toffee with some tangerine resin. Moderate- carbonation. Sweet chocolate malt developing with a caramel tinge, a dash of tangerine, and some herbaceous bitter tang towards the end, where a mildly nutty aftertaste is born. A lively, hoppy brown ale, with good balance of sweetness and dryness - the 'modern' ale drinker really ought to try this offering from a stalwart English brewer in the rustic, 'old-school' style. Alternatively, fans of 'traditional' straightforwardly sweet (and straightforwardly brown) brown ales might not warm to this - but it's still well worth a try. Bottle a month past the Best Before; seems unaffected based on my memory of previous samplings. This is great drinking - not everything needs a gimmick or 'wow factor'; sometimes you just want a tasty balanced brew - it's no coincidence Samuel Smith lists a variety of suggested food pairings on its bottles.
Flaske fra beer palace Oslo. Lys brun. Lukter av nøtter, sjokolade. Smak av sammen, tørr ettersmak.

I have such a soft spot for this beer. It was the first "craft" beer I ever had, way back in college in about 1988. Rediscovered it recently at Purvis Beer in Melbourne. Still a great brown ale, all the lovely deep tones you expect. Ahhhh memories.....

550ml bottle from deli in Northallerton. Pours dark mahogany/brown with a tan head. Aroma is toffee, malt loaf, nutty, Christmas cake, dark fruits and orange peel. Smooth mouthfeel with some soft carbonation. Taste is toffee, caramel, treacle, nutty, Christmas cake, dark fruits and some sugared orange peel. Subtle but traditional quality taste. Slight bitter finish. Really fantastic example of the style.

550ml (5%) shared with Stuartyboy at home on 13 Jun 2020, purchased on 15 May 2020 (bbe Mar 2021): nutty, toffee aroma, amber brown, good pale cream head, no lacing, aromatic, toffee, nutty malt flavour, creamy, moderate fizz, some resin in the finish.
Brown, tan head. Nutty, a bit sweet. Some dried fruit, a bit short aftertaste.

Brown color with a fine fine foam.
Nose. Caramel, notes of grape juice, dried fruits appear when heated.
Taste. Dry, malt, caramel, fried notes, dried fruit notes. In the aftertaste, light bitterness with notes of wood or walnut? Perfectly balanced ale. But there are no nuts here!
500ml bottle from a corner shop in Gospel Oak.  Deep brown.  Aroma of brown bread, malt loaf and nuts. Fruit cake and bready malt flavour.  Fairly light.
Bij het zien van het bier was ik eigenlijk al verkocht. Smaak houdt een mooie balans tussen het zoet en bitter met tonen van karamel en noten.
Bottle from Varsity.  Dark thick brown with decent head.  Malty aroma.  Pretty dry with walnuts malt and a little grass.  Quite nice

Pours a dark brown colour with a beige coloured head 
Notes of roasted coffee and cocoa nibs 
Cask beer found at Wetherspoons in bury ST Edmunds
Fles 35,5cl thuis. Droog, noot, caramel, rood fruittonen, roasted malts, zoetig. (3-4-2020).

Wygląd: Barwa ciemnoczerwono-brązowa, klarowna. Piana beżowa, wysoka, drobnopęcherzykowa i zbita, opada do ostatniej warstwy pozostawiając lacing.
Aromat: Nienachalny. Na średnioniskim poziomie słodowość biszkoptowa, tostowa, orzechowa, herbatnikowa z akcentami karmelu oraz kwiatowo-korzennym chmielem i jabłkowymi estrami na tym samym poziomie. 
Smak: Podobnie jak w aromacie. W ustach półwytrawne i odrobinę mineralne, treściwość średnioniska, wysycenie średnie. Goryczka niska, korzenna, krótka, dobrze zaznaczona i przyjemna. Finisz wytrawny, lekko mineralny z korzenną goryczką i nutami słodowymi. 
Ogólnie lekkie i pijalne, chociaż brakuje trochę więcej słodowości. Z kolei jabłkowych estrów mogłoby być odrobinkę mniej.

55 cl bottle at Gyhallmanti’s. Appearance: clear brown with medium off-white head. Aroma: nutty, soy sauce, sweet malts and some biscuit. Taste: medium sweetness and bitterness. Notes of nuts, malts, some bread and soy sauce.  Palate: medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. Overall: okay

55cl bottle split with SimonBlok and Richardvv. Pours a clear copper brown colour with a medium foamy off white head with decent retention. Aroma of caramel, caramalt, slight bitter hops, burnt sugar. Taste is moderate sweet, medium bitter with a medium dry finish. Notes of malt, caramel, slight yeast, burnt sugar. Texture is oily to watery, medium to light bodied with medium carbonation
Slightly hazy copperish brown. Thin beige head with low retention. Aroma intensity 2/5. Nuts, chocolate and malt aroma, notes of blackcurrant. Vanishing light bitter syrup taste. Light to medium body

Pours a dark bronze or maybe amber color.  Two finger beige head.  Okay retention and good lacing.  A little hazy. 

Aroma is...oddly some sort of liquor staves, bourbon maybe.  Oaky.  Touch of nuts, malty.  Touch of vanilla. 

Taste is oaky bourbon.  Touch of vanilla.  Hazelnut maybe? 

Mouthfeel is feels heavier than it really is, an illusion I guess because of bourbon staves.  It’s more or less neutral.  No aftertaste.  Neither sweet or bitter, it’s boring. 

Overall it’s a bummer.  The only real flavor is the, bourbon staves; and that was unexpected, unwanted, and unwelcome.  I wouldn’t buy it again and I wouldn’t recommend it.
Good,clean ale.I don't have much experience froom brown ales.could be dryer.smooth taste,but could expect more of it.
Clear brown color with tan head. Aroma of dried fruits and raisins. Dried fruit taste along with little bread and raisins. Light to medium body, average carbonation. Not too sweet and enjoyable
Rich dark brown ale with nutty yeasty flavour. Hints of coffee and licorice with marmite umami in the background. Some figgy and prune sweetness. Nice winter warmer.
Light brown color with tanned head. Aroma has caramel, dark malt, nuts and bread. Taste is malty sweet with long quite dry aftertaste. Flavors of dark malt, chocolate, nuts and bread.
0,355 l bottle from Alko Ympyrätalo, Helsinki. Light brown, clear, big head. Taste is quite malty, but not that sweet. Ending is dry but not bitter.
Liquide translucide, belle couleur ambrée, léger nez de fruits à coques. En bouche c'est agréable, fin amer mais pas de quoi y revenir. Correct sans plus
Taste is a bit diluted, this type of beer will have difficulty surviving against more fulsome craft beers.

Bottle 330ml at home. From Alko web shop. BBE AUG 2020. Pours brown with tan head. Aroma haa malts and dried fruits. Flavor has dark malts, bread, dried fruits, hazelnut, hops. Medium body, average carbonation, malty bitter finish.

Brewed August 2018 (Lot no 18228, best before August 2019).
Dark brown / nutty colour. Medium lasting head.
Nose: Green apples, roasted malt, roasted nuts, yeast, hints of molasses. With air come notes of Christmas cake
The arrival comes with slightly sweet, medium roasted malt notes. 
On the mid palate more of the medium roasted malt but drier. Also some fruity green apples. Fine, medium to rich carbonation. Good body. 
The exit and aftertaste are both dry, malty and has some hops bitterness.
A very nice and well balanced brown ale.

A dark reddiesh-brown beer, a head is medium and light beige. Aroma has dried fruitness of raisin, some roastiness. Taste has dried fruitness, raisin, some breadyness, not too sweet. Almost medium bodied. Surprisingly, lots of dried fruitness.

Copper, dark amber and brownish translucent color. Tanned head disappears fast. Aroma of chocolate and malts. Taste is malts, chocolate, light coffee and dry nuttiness. Quite decent and long aftertaste.
Bière cuivrée, claire, avec des arômes maltés, sucrés, et une bouche plutôt douce. Une bière simple, dans le bon sens du terme, et assez légère.
0.55l bottle. Dark copper/brown color with tanned head. Aroma is malty with chocolate, some caramel and nutty notes. Taste is sweet with chocolate notes and nutty flavor. Overall it's very good beer.

Si sente molto l'affumicato, soprattutto caffè, tanti da rendere stucchevole la birra. Si beve con piacere ma non invoglia a berne ancora, forse da trovare un abbinamento giusto
Earlier Rating: 9/5/2019 Total Score: 3.4
Si sente molto l'affumicato, soprattutto caffè, tanti da rendere stucchevole la birra. Si beve con piacere ma non invoglia a berne ancora, forse da trovare un abbinamento giusto
A tall can from Denman Liquor on Denman in Vancouver. Lots of tan head here and a mouthful of nutty malted goodness with a decent hop bitterness in the background. 3.8

Bottle, 0.55l. Clear cola-brown/red pour, two finger frothy beige head. Good retention, medium lasting, lots of lacing on the glass. Malty, nutty nose with herbal notes in the background. 

Thin to medium body, soft carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel and texture, a bit lightweight. Slightly roasted bittersweet taste, malty aroma. Caramel, roasted malt. Nuts, herbs and spices, fruity background. Short to medium finish, subtle lingering bitterness. 

Nicely balanced and flavorful. Good one.
Brown color, middle foam size. Caramel, bread, malt in aroma. Taste is in kvass style. Good beer.

Simply a truly tasty and fulfilling beer. I’m not gonna pretend to taste notes of hazelnut, chocolate, coffee, etc.   I just know this is quite possibly my favorite beer of all-time. Hope you like it at least half as much as I do.

Bottle 0,55L. Clear amber color with big off-white, frothy head. Aroma of nuts, roasted malts, caramel and honey. Taste starts light sweet with cocoa and walnuts, while finish is light to medium bitter with notes of burnt sugar and fresh nuts. I expected smoother body and something rich in taste, but didn't get it from this beer.

Bottle. Dark ruby, thick brownish head. Aroma of hazelnuts, slight caramel, toast, toffee. Taste is medium bitter, hazelnuts on tongue. Light to medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation, long bitter finish.
An english, foggy Brown Ale with creamy head. Aroma is caramel, light coffee, hazel nuts. Taste is bitter and light sweet.
Much superior to Newcastle Brown. Flavoursome. Slightly bitter/sweet. Creamy and nutty with vanilla aftertaste. I had vowed after the tragedy of Newcastle’s Brown to avoid but this changes my mind

This is a very easy drinkable beer. You don't find many browns about except that awful Newcastle bad. 
This, it could be a bit more nutty, more sweet. But it does its beery job well.
Slightly thin, but has gentle sweetness and a very delicate hazlenut taste coming through. 
Easy to drink and does go rather well with wenslydale.
This is like a nice stay at your favourite aunts. 
She also has a lurcher dog. That likes to sit on your Lap when you sleep in the second best armchair.

Bottle @ Home w friends/Panzer, Don, coffee patrol and Martinsen. Appearance: pours clear brown with good off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: caramel, nuts, light chocolate, bread, biscuit and light floral notes. palette: medium malty aroma, average carbonation, medium body, medium to notable sweetness, somewhat balanced by a medium bitterness, average duration and an oily texture. overall: nice malty brownie

Bottle from Beers of Europe. 
Appearance - deep brown with an off white head. 
Nose - hazelnut, walnut and pistachio. Toffee.
Taste - walnut and toffee again.
Palate - close to medium bodied, creamy middle. Rich but dry finish.
Overall - great example of the style.

Deep amber pour, tan head with good retention. Nose of molasses and brown sugar. First taste has some roasty, burnt dark malt notes and a nice nutty sweetness up front. Slightly sticky caramel flavor. A touch too watered down for my liking. Not bad, but there are much better Samuel Smith's offerings out there...

Good, but my expectations were certainly higher after the brilliant Organic Chocolate Stout. Something persisted, though - it's still too watery! Smell is reminiscent of namesake nuts, but in the taste they're nowhere to be found. Slightly creame.

Appearance: Pours clear cooper amber with a generous creamy off-white head, with lacing.
外观：铜色至琥珀色，清澈，丰富细腻的浅黄色泡沫，有挂杯。
4/5

Aroma: Hops, malt, caramel and yeast notes, with a slight hint of bread.
气味：酒花、麦芽、焦糖和酵母香气，伴有轻微的面包气味。
7/10

Taste: Hoppy roasty malty flavor, with some nuts and caramel. Subtle sweetness followed by hoppy bitterness and some tartness. Bitter hoppy finish.
味道：主要呈现酒花和烘烤麦芽风味，伴有些许坚果和焦糖味。入口是微妙的甜味，随后呈现酒花苦味以及些许酸味。尾韵苦，呈现酒花风味。
6/10

Mouthfeel: Medium bodied, texture is smooth, moderate carbonated.
口感：中等酒体，顺滑，杀口感适度。
4/5

Overall: Pleasant and easy.
讨喜、易饮的酒。
12/20
Copper to brown color, medium beige head. Aroma caramel, roasted malt, cherries. Taste brown sugar, roasted malt, caramel, nuts, bitter, oil texture.

A rich Dark Brown appearance, with sweet nutty aroma. Subtle smooth malt taste with none complex finish. At 5% this is a solid none session ale. A Samuel Smiths classic, I will buy this beer time and time again.
355 ml bottle. Clear brown, foamy head. Roasted malt, caramel, dry citrus, breadcrumbs, metal. Malty sweetness, dry bitterness. Medium bodied, watery texture, soft carbonated, dry malty finish. Okay.

This is one of the first breweries I got into when starting to drink craft.  For some reason, I missed this review.  Maybe I was waiting until I got this again to review fresh.  Anyways, been about 2-3 years since I had this, but recall it to be one of my favorite brown ales.  On the thicker side for the style. Semi-creamy texture.  Medium-brown appearance.   Nutty flavors balanced very well with the malts/hop combo.  Now that I am reading the other reviews, going to go this direction next time I go brown...not so much to get a refresher to my memory, but mainly because this is one of the best browns around.

A fine ale with a fine head and nutty aromas. A fine eksample of how SAmuel Smiths keep a High quality

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark brown, medium head. Aroma is sweet, nutty, caramel, toffee, cacao, cherry, roasted malts. Thick texture and cocoa, caramel, malty, marmalade, metallic and nutty flavor.

Color marrón, cristalina. Un dedo de espuma amarillenta con retención media. Aroma a frutos secos y malta. Gusto dulce, malta tostada, azúcar moreno, toque sutil de avellana y cacao, ligero amargor al final del trago. Cuerpo acuoso. Brown Ale british de manual.
Pours clear mahogany with three finger, light tan head.  Aroma is light roast and nuts. Taste is light raisin, moving to nuts and roast.  Finish is roast.  A drinkable brown ale.
Piwo pite jakis czas temu, ocena na podstawie wspomnnień z degustacji, przeniesiona z innego portalu.

Brown ale de 5 % abv, avec sucre de canne.
Mon exemplaire était à 11 mois après sa date.
Couleur châtain roux foncé, à la clarté nette.
Mousse beige, soyeuse, stable à 2 mm.
Arômes de fruits mûrs, molasses, feuilles d'érable, candi.
1ère bouche souple, à l'entame fruits/malt/fût.
Arrière-bouche quasiment de quadruple, avec pointe d'amande.
2ème bouche superbe, à l'harmonie grandiose.
Arrière-bouche riche, longue, complexe.
Longueur qui assure une très belle suite à cette entame du tonnerre.
Les saveurs passent sur un registre moelleux et suave.
Jambes huileuses, longues.
Levure souple, fine, belle ligne.
Alcool superbe pour son niveau, mais il avait vieilli quelque peu ..
et il avait pris quelques grammes de plus !!
Finale splendide.
CONCLUSION : très grande brown, pour laquelle le brasseur donne 
quelques conseils de food pairing … eh oui !! Why not ? disait l'anglais ..
Pour ma part, je vous donne un conseil pour la bière elle-même : 
laissez-la vieillir une petite année de plus que sa date limite ...
là elle est juste à point, et elle fera le dessert à elle seule, sans pairing !!
Pour une brown, un top absolu.

Hadn’t had this old favorite for years.  Wow nice return to the ‘standard’.  Not so over the top sweet or chocolate or coffee - just plain good old malt presence with a bit of balance.  Drinks so easily.  So good and fresh from a 14.9 fl. Oz. Can.  A year later: poured from a 19 oz. bottle: same great, smooth Winter’s day Ale.
Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Brown-copper coloured with a large white head of foam. It has a chocolate and nutty flavour with roasted notes, red fruit and a nutty finish. Very good.

cette brown ale anglaise est mince, et sa mousse est rare mais présente. Au nez, notes très discrètes de sucre d’orge et de boisé. En bouche, elle débute sucrée et ronde, pour se finir sur une note âcre, à la limite amère. Aqueuse, elle recèle quelques céréales très tranquilles. Un brin décevante étant donné la renommée de la brasserie, mais elle manque définitivement de caractère, de punch, bref d’audace.

Caramel, toffee,  malty with roasted almond, walnut and other nutty notes. This brown ale doesn't overdo it with sweetness and a syrupy texture like American varients often do.  A well balanced, warming ale

Clear, brown colored with a red hue, medium beige frothy head. Aroma is of some toasted malt, toffee/caramel, light chocolate, some fruity esters, light nuts. Taste is medium sweet malt, caramel, bit toffee, toast and bit of chocolate, bit estery and some nutty flavor, light+ bitterness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, bit oily.

Brewed at Samuel Smith’s small, traditional British brewery with well water (the original well sunk in 1758 is still in use), best barley malt, roasted barley, yeast and aromatic hops. Nut Brown Ale is relatively dry with a rich amber-brown colour and nutty flavour derived exclusively from small amounts of dark malt. Brown ales are a specialty of northern England. Fermented in ’stone Yorkshire squares’.

Sample@Ølfestival København 2018 (Day 3) - dark brown pour with a beige head. Toasty and roasted malty medium sweet with some caramel, some fudge, nutty accents throughout, medium body, sweet malty finish.

Clear, reddish brown, with a fairly good head. The assertive aroma is malty and just slightly sour, with some bread notes along with hints of sherry and roastiness. There is no sweetness to speak of, but the bitterness isn't too kicky either (just right for the style, imo). The staccato finish is neat, dry and elegant. This is a fairly juicey and surprisingly nuanced beer - by far my favourite brown ale to date.

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.

Couleur ambrée, petite mousse beige . Nez malté caramélisé, orge, avec noisettes fraiches et fruits murs. Gout malté, caramel, notes chocolatées puis noisettes et notes fruits murs. Fin sur le coté fruité noisettes assez seche. Mais nickel pour  5c°
Bottle. Dark amber brown body with light tan head. Aroma is malts fruits nuts. Taste is nice malty caramel. Aftertaste is nice balanced.

08-10-18 // taster at an event at Kuehn Kunz Rosen brewery in Mainz. Brownish with a light beige head. Great malty aromas, nuts, caramel, light roasted notes. Light bodied, could be a bit thicker. Very mild nole hop bitterness.

55cl bottle from Abeervinum, Rimini, Italy. Pours dark brown, reddish, with minimal whitish foam. Aroma is nutty and caramel. Body is not particularly dense, with good carbonation. Taste is fairly sweet and toasted. Minimal bitterness. Finish is regular.
355 ml bottle. Aroma is relatively weak, hints of walnuts and honey. Flavour is dominant malty, medium sweet, light bitter, nutty. Not the best beer from S. Smith, but still a nice one.

0.35l bottle. Pours amber with off-white head. Aroma of walnuts, malt, caramel, an overall general nuttiness. Taste is malt, bitter roast, caramel, nutty (especially walnuts), almonds. Bitter finish. Decent.

Can. Ar: Dried pineapple and red apple; earthy, slight licorice hop aroma; bread crust. Ap: Red-brown and crystal-clear; large off-white head with very good retention, settling into an airy cap of foam with chunks of lacing along the glass sides as it recedes. T: Dried pineapple and red apple, very similar to the nose, sort of like an un-spiced fruit cake; low sweetness; bitterness is low, slightly tannic, with a black tea and licorice accent of flavor; bread crust, biscuits; finish is black tea and apple skin. P: Medium-light body with medium-high carbonation; finish is medium-dry. O: A quaffable English brown ale; malt and fruit flavors are pronounced but not over the top.
(uk, onctueuse sur light acidité de fruits, last fruit amer-terre, pas complexe pour un shilling, à boire au cask)

Aroma is reminiscent of cherries and there is a slight presence of caramel.

Initially some sweetness is detected but subsides into bitterness. I get nutty finish.

Initially a nice carb bite. A nice silky texture on the finish. 

Aftertaste is all caramel and malty bread crust.

Medium body.
God og velsmagende brown ale. Masser af fylde og god aroma. Tilpas med bitterhed
Bottle. Malty aroma, hopy notes, caramel, roasted malts, nutty notes. Tastes the same as aroma, light sweet notes, light to medium bitter. Medium body, malty caramel bitter sweet finish. Good.
One of the all time classic British nut browns. Has all the traditional qualities of the style in spades. Great to finally try it on draft.

Samuel Smith Biere finde ich sehr gut. Meist qualitativ sehr hochwertig. Auch das Nut Brown Ale macht da keine Ausnahme.

Optik
Recht dunkel mit schöner, mittelbrauner Krone.

Geruch

Аромат карамели с оттенками патоки. Цвет темно янтарный. Пена небольшая но постоянная, которая преследует пиво даже после полного употребления. Вкус неожиданно солодовый. Также ощущается карамель и патока, некое присутствие меда. Послевкусие мягкое сладко-карамельное. Пиво очень питкое и водянистое. Ему явно не хватает немного яркости во вкусе, но даже без этого Самуэль Смитс снова держит высокую солидную планку.

Bottle from Stanislaus Brewskovitch, Zwolle. Aroma is malt, caramel, toffee, nuts, and a hint of cocoa. Flavour is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium. Nothing spectacular, but pretty decent Brown Ale.

550ml bottle. Pours a clear amber-brown with a medium, creamy, long lasting, beige head that laces nicely. Sweet aroma of toasted malt, bread, caramel and nuts. Sweet flavour of toasted malt, biscuit, toffee, caramel, molasses and walnut with a dry, bitter hop finish. Medium body with a creamy, smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Very nice, easy drinking.

Reviewed on March 4, 2018. Date code SF20Q1 (June 20, 2017), so it is a bit old. But, if the brewer is satisfied to have beer this old for sale, it is fair game to review it, IMO. Aroma of fruit, caramel, some nutty aroma in there as well. Slightly hazy to clear reddish brown with a tall tan-to off-white thick creamy head. Sweetish caramel intitially in the taste, with fruit and toast. Feel is thin, creamy and smooth. The middle begins to get bitter, with the bitterness intensifying into the finish. As the beer warms, the aftertaste becomes more unpleasant. This beer no doubt suffers from its age, but as it stands, it is not particularly outstanding. OK at best. 

PS: I reviewed this side-by-side with the Ale Asylum Madtown Nutbrown. Not as good as the Ale Asylum. I need to find a fresher Sam Smith brown.

Aroma: 70%

风格：British Brown Ale
酒精度：5.1%vol
原麦汁浓度：12.5°P
灌装日期：2016.09.01

饮用日期：2017.12.25
饮用温度：10℃-12℃

香气：明显、浓郁的麦芽焦糖、太妃糖、面包皮气息，较轻的酒花泥土、花香、药草气息，还有些深色水果的酵母气息稍带一丝丝不明显的酸感。

外观：；酒体为透明的红棕色或棕褐色，色度约22，边缘带一些黄色高光；酒头极如咖啡奶泡一般，米白色混合浅棕色，丰富但不持久，消散后维持薄薄一层完全覆盖在酒体上，挂杯也不错。

风味：入口明显的焦糖、太妃糖风味，还稍有一些烤坚果的气息，中下的酸味，并转出酒花中等偏下的苦味和一些泥土气息，收口柔和稍干，焦糖味与酒花药草味平衡；回味以明显的酒花药草味为主，配合被压制的坚果气息。喝了两三口之后麦芽焦糖、太妃糖气息更加弱化，酸味、酒花泥土药草苦味更明显。

口感：酒体中轻，入口柔和，略有水感，沙口中等。

总体印象：整体平衡偏向英式酒花的泥土、药香的一款英式棕色艾尔，也有可能是放置时间太长导致酒花苦味及明显的酵母酸味更突出。如果风味能更偏近香气的风味，使麦芽焦糖、太妃糖气息不被酒花压制，则感受要好很多，现在这个入口后明显的中药酸苦味真是不好喝。

Bottle. Clear chestnut brown. Moderate off-white head. The nose is caramel, toffee, minor nuts, cocoa. Light body. Fairly dry tasting. Really nutty here. Rich toffee and caramel. Flavourful. Lightly hoppy ending. Floral. It's OK because of the entire dryness. A very pleasant brew.

Botella de 99Cervezas. 
Vierte en un bonito color ámbar oscuro, transparente y bastante brillante para este color. Buena formación de espuma cremosa tintada en vainilla y con burbuja pequeña. Persistencia y adherencia media-baja. Buena carbonatación. 
Intensidad media-baja en nariz. Quizá la primera nota es el plátano muy maduro, enmarcando un aroma claramente dulce. Las notas florales y herbales son muy tenues. También algo de toffee y tras atemperarse, notas de Jerez (requiere dejarla respirar un rato y que coja temperatura). Complejidad media. 
De entre los sabores principales destaca el dulce, aunque de una manera mucho más fresca de lo que daban a entender las notas en nariz. El amargo aparece a continuación de manera suave pero clara y expresiva, estableciendo un fantástico equilibrio con el dulce. También hay algunas notas saladas.
El postgusto muestra notas ajerezadas muy interesantes que resultan francamente agradables. También toques de pasas. A pesar del dulce inicial, no resulta para nada empalagosa, sino que casi parece intentar conseguir un final seco (casi). La persistencia es media y suave pero no se echa de menos una persistencia mayor. Sobresaliente en sabor. 
Ligera en boca y algo efervescente. Extremadamente refrescante a pesar de que las notas dulces en nariz parecían indicar otra cosa. 
Una cerveza que destaca principalmente en boca, aunque se queda un pelín corta en nariz. En cualquier caso, siempre vale la pena tomársela, ya que resulta especialmente agradable y tiene un enorme bebestibilidad. Totalmente recomendable.

En boca aparece un malteado deliciosamente suave. Avellanas, almendras, pasas y caramelo. En resumen, un conjunto dulce que da paso en su final a un amargo muy tenue y elegante. El conjunto nos llena perfectamente de sabor y de postre un final seco pero muy rico.

Taki naprawdę porządny brown ale. Barwa brązowa, aczkolwiek prześwitująca. Piana biała, kremowa, gęsta, bardzo wysoka i trwała. W aromacie orzechy włoskie, nuta toffi, słody karmelowe i nuta czekolady. W smaku słodycz, kremowość, słody karmelowe, a także orzechy, które rozciągały się również na ledwie zauważalną goryczkę. W aromacie na dodatek bardzo delikatne estry. Nagazowanie średnie z małym plusem. Lekka wodnistość. Ale ogólnie bez większych wad, a z masą zalet. Smaczne.

Bruno scuro con riflessi rossastri, la schiuma è nocciola, cremosa e abbondante, poco persistente. 

Naso molto invitante che regala note di toffee, caramello, biscotto, noci e frutta secca. In sottofondo una lieve nota terrosa molto piacevole. In bocca si rivivono le stesse emozioni. E’ una birra morbidissima, che ha poche bollicine e un corpo medio. Nocciole, noci, mandorle avvolgono il palato accarezzandolo in maniera intrigante. Il finale si spinge verso territori amarognoli e terrosi, che bilanciano benissimo la bevuta.

From 2011 notes:

When I first tried this beer about 20 years ago, I thought it was probably the best beer I had ever had. (I was probably right). Having one for the first time since joining BA, I had high hopes but some anticipation that it could be disappointing - I’ve tried a lot of beers over the past 2 decades. Well, it was not at all disappointing. Perhaps not the very best brown ale I’ve ever had, but excellent, upholding its reputation as a gold standard of English browns. 

Plenty of caramel malt in the aroma. Tastes only slight nutty at first, but a more notable nuttiness in the excellent malty finish. Perfect balance of flavors. Slightly fruity.

Mouthfeel - a tad thin; otherwise excellent, with perfect carbonation. 

O - outstanding example of style. Refined and superbly crafted.

Classic English brown ale so it’s about time to taste it... Thick, moussy, pale greyish beige head retaining quite well, over a clear deep reddish bronze coloured beer with burgundy hue, translucent. Aroma of caramel candy and butterscotch, damp cloth, wet paper, candied cherry, honey, hazelnut paste, dried tree leaves, ’haemoglobin’ iron, sugared English tea, lots of fig. Clean, sweetish onset of fig and dried banana countered with a dull elderberry sourishness, soft carbo, very smooth and slick body, very caramelly maltiness with nutty accents, a bit metallic, going from sweet to subtly bittersweet in the end, very juicy but with the bitterness further enhanced by a dash of earthy, leafy hops, lingering in the back of the mouth for a while. CAMRA has tried to distinguish between northern brown ale and southern brown ale and apparently this one belongs to the former category, like the famous Newcastle Brown; yet it seems to surpass its renowned congener in subtlety and balance.  I would recommend this to anyone who wants to get acquainted with English brown ale: this is a classic in many senses of the word.  Thanks to Samuel Smith for keeping alive waning English beer styles - did they not reinvent porter and imperial stout as well?

(Bottle) Pours deep brown with good dense off-white head. Nice aroma - toffee, hops, hints of nuts. Great carbonation gives smooth creamy palate. Excellent.

550 ml bottle bought at Gorgeous Wine & Cigar in Yuen Long.



Looks: Deep amber brownTwo finger head with crumpety light beige foam which lasted for 2 minutes. Beautiful sticky lacing with active small carbonation.



Aroma: Fragrant and sweet roasted Ale malt, with strong caramel, light almonds, sticky toffee, sugar, rich chocolate, raisins, yeast and light grass.



Taste: Mid to light sweet, light-roasted Ale malt, with light roasted nuts, strong metallic, tartness, strong caramel, light toffee, molasses notes, very light red fruits, dry biscuits, yeast, fair lemon, low bitter hops and grass.



Body: Light body. Watery and dry palate.



Mouth Feel: Very malty but in a very watery body, maybe due to wheaty influence as there is potent tartness. Very strong caramel with thin red fruits, toffee, sweetness fairly light. Strong biscuit, dry low hops to round. Quite good so far.



Hoppiness: Light grass in nose, Lemon and grass in taste. Bitterness is moderate for a lasting, fairly astringent malty finish.



After taste: Very dry. Malty and fairly bitter to mouth.



Coments:After Sam Smith’s great Imperial Stout and Oatmeal Stout, I was expecting more or less greatness from this one. Well, only half really: nice head and neat roasty aroma aside, the palate is too watery thin and very dry, the empty Northern Brown Ale taste strikes again. It has the looks but only has half the substance. Decent but not worth buying again.

Bottle: Chestnut brown pour with moderate translucency, creamy beige head on top. Aroma of caramel malts, nuts, woodchips, & a modest stale twinge somewhere in the back. Almost papery? Flavor is a bit sweeter up front, but the sweetness is quickly blunted by a dry caramel dust & nutty attack that sends you into an abrupt finish. Well attenuated, perhaps a little too well for the style. Nothing lingering in the finish. A hint of mid-palate earthy bitterness offsets the caramel malts. An okay brown ale at best; there are many others I would choose over this.
nutty aroma, apear brown without any head, taste light bitter, average carbonation medium bodied and a short bitter aftertaste.

Pleasant, mildly fruity nut brown. A good example of the style. (14/20)

Botella de @Vivalabirra, Oviedo. casa. 21/02/2015 Color marrón. Transparente, espuma blanca. Carbonatación baja y cuerpo medio. Sabor a caramelo.
Weak aroma of malt and hazelnut. Pours a reddish brown, short lasting tan head. Pleasant mild taste of nuts and malt. Medium body with a hazelnut finish.

Poured from a bottle. Medium brown color, medium frothy off white head. Mild hazel nut aroma. Medium body with a slight tart flavor and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It pours a medium brown color with a small off white head. It has the aroma of nuts, toast, cereal and caramel. It tastes like caramel, toffee, nuts and toast. This is another great beer from this brewery. I’m glad that I bought it and will try to drink more from this brewery in the future.
550 ml bottle, pours dark brown with a small bubbly head. Aroma is caramel malt, toffee, dark dried fruit and nut. Medium to full bodied. Creamy texture with soft carbonation. Finish is balanced.

ASPETTO: mogano abbastanza scuro con riflessi rubino, schiuma fine, poco abbondante e poco resistente. AROMA: caramelloso e fruttato, note di marzapane. Molto invitante. GUSTO: vari sapori, tra i quali emergono caramello, marzapane, frutta secca. Emerge anche un acidulo che si sente. A lungo andare è leggermente stucchevole al palato, con un corpo tendente un po’ all’acquoso. Carbonizzazione bassa. CONCLUSIONE: buona birra, veramente piacevole. Peccato per la sua "acquosità" e lieve acidità che un po’ stona, altrimenti le avrei dato sicuramente più punti.

Bottle, 550 ml. Pours dark brown/ruby with a finger of cream coloured head. Moderate lacing. Rather spicy on the nose, with the likes of nutmeg, vanilla and coriander at the forefront of a solid caramel and brown sugar malt base with plenty of almonds. A few dark fruits, milk chocolate and even a bit of navy rum also make appearances. Lots going on here. Wholemeal bread and muscavado sugar dominate the taste, with the spicy and nutty edges sticking around though perhaps less distinctively so. Finish is very dry with further nutty elements, more specifically walnut and hazelnut now. Body is decent medium with oily texture and average carbonation; no complaints here.

Pours a deep mohagany with fiery highlights, few carbs and topped by a finger or so of tanned foamy/creamy head. Retention is medium-low and I got some spotted lacing. The nose explodes with nutty malts, toffee, caramel, dark honey. The hops come through with a floral element. As for taste, the brew is nutty backed by a sharp burnt toast where the hops express a nice earthy bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium dense and the brew finishes with the previously mentioned bitter hops. Pretty nice product but with its low ABV, look for a fresh bottle and don’t age it. Cheers!

355ml bottle. Pours hazy reddish amber with one finger of fine textured creamy light beige head. Aroma is sweet malts, caramel, molasses and yes, some nuttiness along some light dark fruits and vegetal notes. Taste is similar with the initial sweetness balanced by a mild final dry bitterness. Nuts and dark fruits again. Light to medium body, medium carbonation.

One of my personal favorite beers. This beer pours a dark amber/red color with a thick khaki head. There is a lot of streaming bubbles. The aroma is burnt wood, dark fruits, malty, nuttiness, sweet, caramel, brown sugar, and breadiness. The taste is creamy hazelnut, dark roasted malts with very little bitterness at the end. This beer is sweet but not too much and also has a rich hazelnut and brown sugar flavor.

(Bottle 0.55l , half o bottle) Clear, brown colour with dark red flashes. Off white, medium sized, medium fast falling head. Medium body, low to medium carbonation, watery texture. Aroma: Medium sweet, mostly malty, caramel,toasted malts, bready, slightly hoppy, herbal, earthy aromas. Taste is malty, light sweet with toasted notes, medium strong nuts, soft caramel. Nuts in short to medium long finish. Mineral mouthfeel, toasted aftertaste. Pleasant malty beer, mostly toasted, very easy to drink.
Not quite sure what the fuss is about this stuff. It’s got a nice nutty/toffee aroma, but it’s also kind of watery, and has way more mineral taste than I’d like. Decent but kinda blah
Good white head that persists. Moderate carbonation. Sweet toffee aroma. Taste- balanced sweetness, toffee & caramel. low-mod bitter finish. Great beer.

550 ml bottle. Pours a clear dark golden brown with lasting light tan head and thick lacing. Aroma is mild and sweet: malty, with a hint of roasted nuts. Flavor is same, with malt dominating upfront, and nutty character in the finish. Thin to medium bodied, moderate carbonation, malty sweet finish.

550 mL bottle poured. Love these uniformed bottles by the way. Pours a copper color with a lasting head. Super sweet candy malt aroma. Flavor is really mild. Slightly nutty, not quite as much as I expected. Dry malt finish. Another pretty good beer from these guys. Enjoyed it.
Still probably my favorite nut brown. Delivers on both taste and nostalgia. Good flavor.
Amber with medium low carbonation, light caramel and chocolate aroma and flavor, the nutty character is very subtle. Well attenuated, dry and crispy. A good beer, good brown ale, English style.
Toll malzig-nussiges Bier. Nicht zu süß, schön trocken-malzig mit tollem nussigen Unterton. Schöne Ale-characteristik, leicht herber, nussig-malziger Nachgeschmack. Lecker!

Poured from 12 oz bottle into pint glass

Appearance: pours a thick, sudsy off white head that slowly recedes with moderate lacing. Color is a mostly clear light brown with plenty of streaming carbonation.

Aroma: rich roasted malts, caramel, nuts, earthy hops.

Mouthfeel: medium bodied, frothy, with a wet finish.

Flavor: terrific combination of roasted malts, sweet caramel, ripe fruit, and a definite nuttiness. There are some tangy and earthy hops in the backbone.

Overall: a world class beer for sure. Perhaps the standard by which all other English style Nut Brown’s should be judged.

Poured from bottle. Pours a clear brown with rich, thick soft khaki head. Aroma - malt, toffee, touch of milk chocolate. Taste - definitely some malt, nutty, touch of English hops. Smooth and delicious.
550ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours mid brown with a white head. Aroma of chocolate, caramel and toffee. Bittersweet creamy finish.
Clear medium brown pour. Tan head. Nutty malty aroma. Rich nutty malty with slightly bitter finish. Good served out of the fridge for a while with some funky nutty cheese.
nutty aroma, apear brown without any head, taste light bitter, average carbonation medium bodied and a short bitter aftertaste.
Bottle. Clear brown color, beige head. Aroma of nutella on toast. Taste is similar.

50cl bottle. Clear brown colour with a thin tan head. Toffee, caramel, dough, vanilla and nut fruits in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is more on the bitter side with some fruity notes and a dry/sour finish. Overall, a very good beer.
Bottle. Dark copper with a beige head. Caramel and toffee aromas. Sticky toffee with a molasses and dry finish.

Gusher. Fawn head, copper to hazel clear body with red tones.
Aroma; dough, rye bread, dark wort, dark malts, fruits.
Taste; nutty caramel malts, sweet hazelnut syrup, prunes, fruity mild hops.
Normal body and carbonation. Sweet finish.
[35.5cl brown bottle, abv5%, BB.NOV14]

Bottle from The Vineyard. Clear brown, thin off white head. Nutty brown malt nose. Lovely flavour, loads of hazelnuts, touches of coffee, some fruity bitterness from the hops. Decent body, fairly high carbonation, complex finish. Really beautiful.

Drinkable, but not one of my favorite from the wonderful selection from Samuel Smith's wonderful brewery.

A malty and quite sweet aroma. Smooth and quite rich texture. Full flavoured with a nice balance of sweet versus dry.

Pours reddish brown with a foamy tan head that lingers long. Nose is a bit like raisins with a hint of caramel. Taste is on the dry side with a touch of bitterness. Not particularly appealing to me. Medium body. Vigorous carbonation. Nice brew.

Bottle by a friend. Aroma fruity, dark fruits, also caramel . Clear amber to brown colour. Taste is mostly bitter, lightly metallic, otherwise light roasted malt and some mild grassy hoppiness. Thin bodied. Overall average beer.

Reddy brown appearance. Shines like a ruby. Clean tasting with a hoppy hit. A little fizzy. Strong fruity aroma.

rra marrone, color mattone, schiuma a frana grossa beige, persistente e compatta. Aroma di caramello, toffee, un po’ di cioccolata. Cioccolata fondente, caramello, tanto tofee, polvere di cacao. Pours a nut brown (?) with a just off white that sticks around. Aroma opens up a little after the head bubbles down: caramel, floral, dough, and some vanilla. Taste is very well balanced but nods a little heavy towards bitter/sour. Palate is fairly clean with some sticky bitter. Good brew. Would drink again. Would not buy again.
Beautiful amber brown color. Hints of roasted nuts. Full bodied but drinkable. Very good beer and a nice switch from the pale ales and IPA’s I normally drink.

550ml bottle. Aug 14. Pours a reddy, amber-brown colour with a dense light tan head which lasted well and left some nice lacing. Aroma of sweet butterscotch and nuttiness. Medium sweetness and an underlying medium bitterness. Creamy, smooth body with a surprisingly thin body. Bitter, almost dry finish. In short: smooth drinkable chocolate beer.
Aroma: sweet chocolate, with no roasted sensation, and prunes.

Palate: a little chocolate biterness, very creamy.

Bottle 55 cl from Barleywine in Copenhagen. Deep brown red with a very nice beige head. Black currant, raisins, very nice bitterness, nutty, some caramel, . Medium/light body, medium carbonation, bitter finish, dry. Felt a bit thin, could maybe have some more malts to back up the flavours. Otherwise very nice and interesting taste combinations.

Body is a bit to thin and carbonated. A really good brown ale with ale the malty nuttiness you’d expect. Could have had fuller body though.
Brown with an off white head - Malty aroma with some caramel - Good malt body that has sweet caramle malt - Caramel and sweet malt goes into the finish - This was nice
good ale, no wow factor, but can you really expect a wow from a traditional brown ale? this one is perfect for the style. thin in body, but with a great taste and classic nose."
brown beer with a little light brown head. Some hints of caramel. Tastes bitter and nice: nuts hard to discover till the finish.

Brown bodied, tan head. Biscuit malts, nutty, lager like fermentation, caramel cookies. Light body, soft malt sweetness, not that expressive. Nice but I expected more, a bit too clean. (33cl bottle from Saveur Bière)
Great beer. Amazing aroma. Very complex. Thought it tasted a bit like carmel and coffee and nuts.

Bottle Pours dark brown with an off-white head. Aroma and taste of roasted malt dark chocolate and an underlying slightly earthy dankness Dry palate throughout. Decent brown but I am more of an American brown fan than of the English style browns.

Poured from a pint bottle, into a giant Paulaner dimple stein at around 50 degrees F.

A: Poured a clear brown, not unlike watered-down cola, though holding it to sunlight reveals a beautiful bronze red-amber beer. A thick pale head formed with large bubbles, which dissipated somewhat quickly, leaving only a ring around the very edge of the glass. No lacing formed at all in the glass. Plenty of bubbles appear along the bottom of the beer, occasionally shooting upwards as single bubbles rather than streams.

S: Toasty caramel malt woven through with a heavy hazelnut / chestnut presence, the nose is primarily sweet and warm.

T: Opening with toasted caramel malt with the usual hints of toffee, the flavor opens nicely into a blend of nuttiness, featuring the aforementioned hazelnuts and chestnut. There is a hop presence that also appears, which stays in the background and takes the edge off the malt sweetness. The finish ends quickly, without much lingering aftereffect.

M: Sparkling and medium-bodied, this is a lively ale to drink.

O: A salute to Tadcaster on an all-around enjoyable brown!

330ml bottle served in a chalice glass.
A: Pours a nice very nice dark amber color forming a creamy and solid medium tan head. Good retention and lots of thin lingering lacings left in the glass. 
S: Great fruity nose. Strong notes of roasted and caramel malts. Strong notes of brown sugar, grapes, dry fruits and roasted nuts.Hints of wood and scotch. Flowery hops.
T: Great mouth too. Slightly sweet upfront. Strong notes of roasted and caramel malts, grapes, dry fruits, nuts, brown sugar, oak, scotch and grassy and a bit citrus hops profile. Medium hops bitterness in the end. Good bittersweet balance.
M: Medium body. Average carbonation. Roasted and fruity aftertaste. Strong notes of brown nuts left in the mouth for a long time. 
O: Great drinkability. Classic and delicious British Brown Ale.

[ BA Review @ 4/19/2010 ]

Bottle@home. Two finger foam. Brown clear. Caramalty notes. Sweet dry bitter nutty mint taste. Medium body. Nice.
Bottle. Clear mahogany liquid with light beige head. Light to medium body, medium carbonation. Bitterish with aroma of roasted sugar. Touch of caramel. Medium sweetness. Watery.

W aromacie słodowość i orzechy a także lekki chmiel. Połaczenie aromatów przywodzi mi na myśl jakąś oranżadę, taki słodki, nieco cukierkowy. Wyczuwam także lekką żelazistość. Goryczka co najwyżej średnia , lekko słodki posmak także jest. Nasycenie wysokie a także całkiem wysoka pijalność. Nie zaskakuje natomiast ani smakiem, ani aromatem. Warka do 05.2014r.
Clear brown color, average sized tan head that quickly disappeared. Medium body, soft carbonation. Aroma of caramel and nuts. Sweet with very little bitterness. OK I guess.

Bottle from greens and part of my adventure of getting through the most rated list. Molasses. Lots of molasses some caramel and a bit of light but flavors. Almond. Finish is a touch sweet and caramel again. Decent but not worth adding to a regular rotation.

Bottle at 28 Springs. Pours medium brown with two fingers of head. Aroma is slight roast nutty slight maltiness. Flavor follows. Slightly bitter. Nice beer. Medium to light bodied. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Transfer from BA review on 12-10-12-
 Poured from bottle into pint glass

 Appearance- Pours a light brown- mahogany color with a big off white head. The head has a great level of retention hanging around for quite some time with it very slowly fading to give a great level of lacing.

 Smell - The aroma is of a malty and nut aroma. The malty aroma is mostly of a brown bread nature and is complimented well by a caramel and toffee sweetness smell. The nut smell is a nice blend of a walnut and almond aroma which when combined with the sweet smells creates a great nut brown aroma overall.

Taste – The taste starts out with some sweet caramel and a malty flavor of a brown bread nature. Nutty flavors of a mostly walnut nature become more and more prevalent as the taste advances. An almost cider like flavor also develops more toward the middle of the taste. This results in a sweetening of the beer, which over time then starts to fade as the caramel and toffee loss some ground. A grassy and earthy hop flavor come to the taste at the end, bittering the taste ever so slightly. With the lessening of some of the sweetness that was originally upfront, a bready, walnut, and lightly grassy hop flavor are left to linger on the tongue.

Mouthfeel – The body of the brew is a little on the thinner side with a carbonating level that is on the below average to average side. Not bad, although a little more creaminess and chewiness may have been better for the nut and bready flavors of the brew.

Overall- A easy drinking nut brown. Not the smoothest of flavor transitions and a little weak in body, but still one to try if you get a chance.
Roasted caramel malts and gently sweet fruits, but a little too little of both. Ultimately a bit watery and forgettable.
Tastes fairly similar to Newcastle, but has a stronger, more pronounced flavor and bitterness as well as a nice chocolatey aroma. Still seemed a bit watery on the palate.

Pours chestnut in colour, clear, with a big pillowy off white head. Nutty, malty, caramel, and hops in the aroma. Medium to full mouthfeel, nutty, almond, hop hints, lots of malt, dark fruit hints, some chocolate in the background, raisin juice, some carbonation. Very nice ale.
Mørkbrun farve med lys beige skum. Lukt av røstet malt og karamell. Smak av røstet malt og karamell. Fruktig. Melkebaren.
Fin gyllen kastanjebrun farge. Duft av rosiner, nøtter og syrlige frukter. Tynt lag skum, ring langs kant. Smak av nøtter og noe eikepreget.

30th July 2014
Bottle in the lovely Princess Louise. Bright clear amber beer, good pale cream colour head. Smooth airy palate with light fine carbonation. Tangy malts with touches of unsweet toffee and molasses. Light dried fruits, some bitterness. Finishes dry and crispy carbonated nibble. Decent malt led beer.
Aroma of nuts, biscuity malt. Taste is malt forward, followed by a nice nutty finish. Very good!

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, nuts, 
Appearance-ruby, clear, tan foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, slick feel, lively, long finish
Overall-very good

550ml bottle from Mitchell’s Wines, Meadowhead - Superb clear red brown body, thick white head, lacing all the way. Very pretty. The smell was nutty and malty leading into a decent sugary note but not overbearing. The taste was sweet and nutty/malty leading into a decent rich malty aftertaste and dry finish. I expected a bit more from this, but it still puts a lot of others to shame.

Appearance is dark brown with ruby highlights and a thick off white head. Aroma is all malt, mostly caramel and toast. Taste is very malty, with a combination of caramel, toast, toffee, and bread. Sharp hop bitterness helps balance the high malt character. Mouthfeel is medium with a medium carbonation. Finishes dry on the palate with a crisp bitterness and slightly lingering malt. Overall, seemed very rich in malt as opposed to a lighter, slightly nutty character I was expecting
Bottle. Pours more red than brown. Nice white head. Malty aroma, maybe a little nutty note, but could be just a suggestion. Taste is also on malty way, some melanoidin is present too. Low carbonatedm

Dark, rich, deep flavours with a nutty and bitter finish. Very drinkable. One of Sam Smith's better brews.-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10
Brown with a tinge of red, little head. Medium body. Aroma of malt and strong tea, accompanied by over-ripe fruit in the taste. Nuttiness comes in mostly at the end. Very good.
Aromes de nous, crosta de pa i caramel. En boca trobo café, xocolata amarga, pa i nous. Bona per postres dolços.

Színe az elnevezése alapján nem okoz túlzottan nagy meglepetést, mogyoróbarna testére vastag habpaplan kerül. Illata némiképp visszafogott, akárcsak az íze, mely kissé fehérborszerű zamatokkal indít, majd előkerülnek az enyhén pörkölt, malátás jegyek is, valamint szinte önkéntelenül is mogyoró, dió aromáit véljük felfedezni benne, a címke által sugallt mandula megjelenéséhez azonban kissé talán nagyobb képzelőerő szükségeltetik. Egy nem túl harsány, viszont mindenképpen hangulatos és kellemes ízvilágú ale.

A nutty taste with desent aftertaste full malty taste and hoppy aroma. I think it isnt as good as samuel smiths imperial stout but a decent one.

Botella de 330ml. Copa Pokal. Color cobre con tintes marrones y esponjosa corona beige con bastante buena retención. Aromas florales, de leve sulfuro y pasas redondeados por notas de chocolate por detrás. Entrada vivaz con sabores caramelizados y chocolateados que aportan una sensación balsámica. Cuerpo medio y carbonatación medio/baja. Textura sedosa. Final seco y leves toques de frutos secos en el retrogusto. Bien equilibrada, de trago fácil y deliciosa!!
330ml bottle. Footed Pokal glass. Brownish copper color headed by beige foam showing good retention. Floral, banana, very low sulfur & slight raisin aromas rounded by chocolate notes on the back. It builds a thick and foamy head with a creamy tan color over a dark reddish brown body. The body has good clarity and some visible carbonation. The head has very good retention, lasting until the last sip, and it leaves light tan lacing on the glass. The aroma has a strong malty character with notes of mixed nuts and mild hops. It has a malty, sweet bread character that’s doughy and nutty. The presence of hops is mild and only noticeable towards the finish. Its carbonation is mild and the body is about medium making the texture smooth and creamy. This is a very enjoyable brown ale.

355ml bottle. BB nov 14. Dark brown in color, lacing, light brown head. Bready, sugary sweet, nutty aroma. Flavor has dark bread, sweetness, toasted malt, hops. Dry finish. Sweetish. Not really to my liking. Sweet dark bread I don´t like.

Un liquide roux limpide qui a une mousse respectable, qui n’a cependant pas beaucoup de prestance et réussi quand même à baver une dentelle lorsqu’elle se résorbe. Un nez de fraîcheur, en fait, de journée venteuse où on arrive à sentir peu d’odeurs. Il y a quelque chose qui peut ressembler à du caramel, qui lui est en harmonie avec du malt et des écailles de noix. Plus intéressant en bouche, avec une amertume bien douce et des saveurs poivrées. Les noix sont palpables sur la langue et procurent un bel apport au gouter. Une légère acidité vient un peu brouiller les cartes. M.A. Mars 2015 (1073-140514)

I’ve been looking forward to try this brew for a while, and it does not disappoint! Pours a beautiful brown amber color, solid off-white head. Aroma is roasty malt and caramel sweetness, anticipates the taste. The taste is excellent, malty, earthy bitterness, nutty, all as promised. Highlight is the strong flavor intensity! Finishes clean and dry, with a strangely satisfying mustiness. Didn’t notice any hoppy notes but I don’t mind that for this style. The only detractions are for a thin body and light mouthfeel that seems out of proportion with the full flavor. Overall a classic English brown ale, more flavorful than most.

Usual 550ml Bottle: BBD Apr 14, poured into an Abbot Ale glass tankard at home on 17th Nov 13.

Looks impressive: clear body of redwood (teak/mahogany), a deep blanket of beige foam sits on top, nothing moves as you stare at the glass, apart from carbonation bubbles rising through the body. One of those moments to savour.

The nose is dry, as is the taste: malts rule the roost here, nutty (obviously by the name) and slightly over roasted in smell and flavouring.
